concept.title: About the Zipper service
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides an overview about the Zipper service.

conbody.p: The Zipper service is used to automate the process of zipping and unzipping files and then transfer them from one location to another within your system. Zipping refers to the operation when the service compresses a set of files and then stores them into a zip file. Unzipping refers to the operation when the service extracts the compressed files from a zip file. You can configure the service to perform the operation at a regular interval automatically.
The service requires certain parameters to receive its input. Based on the input parameters, the service does zipping and unzipping of files.

link.desc: This topic provides information about the parameters that are required by the Zipper service to perform its operation.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Install the Zipper service
task.shortdesc: Use the below procedure to install the service in your system.

taskbody.prereq: Ensure that your system has Windows 9 or above installed. The Zipper service is compatible with these version of Windows.

step.info: The Home page of the website appears.

step.cmd: Select Download at the top of the page to download the package.
After the download is complete, double-click the package to open it.
Double-click ZipperService.exe to install the service in your system.

taskbody.result: The above procedure installs the service in your system. You can go to the Services application of Windows to view the Zipper service in the list of services that are installed in your system
taskbody.postreq: Configure the parameters that are required by the service to perform zipping and unzipping.

link.desc: This topic provides information about the parameters that are required by the Zipper service to perform its operation.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: About the service parameters
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides information about the parameters that are required by the Zipper service to perform its operation.

conbody.p: Parameters are certain values that the service requires to perform its operation. The file in which you configure the parameters is known as configuration file. This file must end with .ini extension to make it readable by the service. You can use any text editor, such as Notepad or Notepad++, to create the configuration file.
You must be a system administrator to configure the parameters. Make sure that the configuration file is in the same directory where the Zipper service is installed.

The following screen capture displays an example of the parameters in the configuration file. The Zipping Values section lists the parameters that the service uses to zip files, and the Unzipping Values section lists the parameters that the service uses to unzip files.

image.alt: Configuration file showing an example of the parameters

conbody.p: The parameters are explained in the below table.
conbody.note: Every time you modify a parameter in the configuration file, make sure to restart the service to bring the change into effect.

row.entry: Defines the source directory to pick files for zipping.
Defines the destination directory to save the zipped file.
Defines the gap between two consecutive executions of the service. For example, in the configuration given above, the gap between two consecutive executions is 5 minutes.

Defines the files extension that the service should recognize in the source directory to begin the zipping operation. In the absence of this file, the service can not start zipping.
Note that the source folder should have only one file with the extension that is defined in the TriggerFile parameter. For example, in the above parameters, the trigger file is a file with the .oxi extension.
Defines the source directory to pick a zip file for extraction.
Defines the destination directory to keep the extracted files. The service creates folder in the given directory with the same name as the zip file being unzipped.

link.desc: Use the below procedure to configure the parameters for the Zipper service.
Use the below procedure to run the service.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Configure the parameters
task.shortdesc: Use the below procedure to configure the parameters for the Zipper service.

step.cmd: Open the directory where the Zipper service is installed in your system.
step.info: Mostly, the service installs in the C:\Program Files\Zipper Service directory. If the service is not installed in the same directory in your system, search Zipper Service in the Search field of the C drive.

step.cmd: Right-click in the directory, select New Text Document to have a Notepad file in the directory.
step.info: If you have any other text editor installed in your system, you can use its document to create the configuration file.

step.cmd: Rename the file to Zipper Service.
Double-click the file or right-click and select Open to open the file.
Create the Zipping Values and Unzipping Values sections in the file.
Add the parameters as shown in the below example and replace values given in the angled brackets with the actual values.

image.alt: Add the parameters shown in the screen capture.

taskbody.result: The configuration file is ready to use by the Zipper Service.

link.desc: This topic provides information about the parameters that are required by the Zipper service to perform its operation.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: Stages in zipping and unzipping operations
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides information about the different stages that the Zipper service goes through to perform zipping and unzipping of files.

conbody.p: The service does zipping and unzipping automatically based on the parameters given in the configuration file. However, in each operation, the service reads a different set of parameters and works in the order defined below.

section.title: Stages in zipping
section.p: In the zipping operation, the service receives its input from the parameters that are defined in the Zipping Values section of the configuration file. The zipping operation happens in the following order.

ol.li:
Firstly, the service searches for the trigger file in the source directory.
The TriggerFile parameter in the configuration file specifies the type of the trigger file by defining its extension, such as .oxi, .ocx, etc.
Secondly, the service compresses files that are available in the source directory into a zip file and then places the zip file in the destination directory.
At last the service deletes the source files and the trigger file from the source folder.

section.title: Stages in unzipping
section.p: In the unzipping operation, the service receives its input from the parameters that are defined in the Unzipping Values section of the configuration file. The unzipping operation happens in the following order.

ol.li: Firstly, the service picks a file for unzipping from the directory specified in the UnzipFomPath parameter.
Secondly, the service extracts files from a zip file and then places them in the destination directory.
At last the service deletes the zip file from the source folder after extraction.

link.desc: This topic provides information about the parameters that are required by the Zipper service to perform its operation.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Run the Zipper service
task.shortdesc: Use the below procedure to run the service.

step.cmd: Make sure that the configuration file is created in the same directory where the service is installed, and the parameters have correct values.
Open the Services application to view the list of all the services in your system.
step.info: You can search the application by typing Services in the Search field on the Task bar.

step.cmd: Locate the Zipper service in the list of services.
Do one of the following to start the service:

ul.li: Select Run the Service available at the top of the left pane.
Right-click the service and then select Start to run it.

taskbody.result: The service starts doing its operation.

link.desc: Use the below procedure to configure the parameters for the Zipper service.

concept.title: Logging of service operations
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides information about the log file where the Zipper service logs its operational details.

conbody.p: The Zipper service logs details of each operation in the ZipperServiceTrace.txt trace file. The service creates this file automatically in the same folder where it is installed.
